alert.note: Alert for Newton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 9:31PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Newton County through 1000 PM EDT... At 931 PM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms extended from Almon to Starrsville, and moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Covington, Oxford, Porterdale, Newborn, Mansfield, Almon, Starrsville and Brick Store. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
